title: A holographic study on QCD phase transition and neutron star properties
authors: Xin-Yi Liu, Yue-Liang Wu, Zhen Fang
abstract:
We investigate the QCD phase transition and its phase structure within
Einstein-Maxwell-Dilaton-scalar system and compare the results with those
obtained from the Einstein-Maxwell-Dilaton system. It is shown that both models
reproduce behavior consistent with lattice QCD. In particular, the
Einstein-Maxwell-Dilaton-scalar system exhibits a first-order phase transition
in the pure gauge sector, aligning with predictions from Yang-Mills theory.
Based on these models, we construct a holographic model for neutron stars,
incorporating leptons to satisfy electric charge neutrality, and examine the
cold equation of state, the mass-radius relation, and tidal deformability of
neutron stars. It is demonstrated that the Einstein-Maxwell-Dilaton-scalar
system enables us to describe neutron star properties that meet current
astrophysical constraints.
